IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TERI's principal purpose is to promote programs that provide support for financing and other initiatives to assist students and their families in obtaining greater access to educational opportunities and acheive their educational goals.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TERI's principal purpose is to promote programs that provide support for financing and other intiatives to assist students and their families in obtaining greater access to educational opportunities and acheive their educational goals.
IRS990.Description: College Access and Success Programs: TERI offers comprehensive information, guidance and practical help to assist underserved indivduals achieve their post-secondary educational goals through College Planning Centers (CPCs) and school-based programs in urban communities. Achievements: TERI's CPCs served an estimated 25,000 individuals through outreach, Center visits, phone calls and email. TERI's school-based activities served 2,600 students; 556 were high school seniors and roughly 84% of those seniors enrolled in programs of post-secondary education. The remaining 2,044 students were in grades 7-11 and participated in college campus tours, summer programs, academic support, test preparation, assistance with college preparatory course selection and researching colleges and scholarships. College transition support services were provided to 51 high school graduates who were at risk of not enrolling and persisting in programs of post-secondary education.

Activity2.Description: Education Finance Program: TERI's education finance program provided guarantees on private student loans. These loan guarantees enabled students with little or no credit history to obtain loans to help close the gap between education costs and other resources such as financial aid, savings and family support. Through these loan guarantees, TERI brought together lenders, schools, students and families to make available low-cost, high quality financing for post-secondary education.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TERI's endowment funds are intended to be used for purposes of the furtherance of higher education through improvements in the administration of and access to financial aid and support of higher education information centers.

Investment in Subsidiary, -196,833. Reorganization expense item from financial statements included in total revenue, interest earned on accumulated cash resulting from Chapter 11 proceedings $2,937,001.
Reorganization expense items from financial statements included in total expense, Professional Fees 6,911,962 amd Loss on Settled Transactions 1,257,737.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Willis J Hulings III, CEO and President, participated in a SERP, calendar year 2009 accrued benefits totalled $14,668.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Before the Form 990 is finalized, TERI's Finance Department prepares a draft, presents it to senior management and counsel for review and comment, and then provides it to its Board of Directors for their comments. When all comments have been reviewed and the form is finalized, the Finance Department files the form.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TERI's Board of Directors has adopted a Conflicts of Interest Policy. Each January, all TERI officers and directors are required to read the policy and affirm their understanding, agreement and commitment to the policy by signing an Acknowledgement and Disclosure Form. The responses to questions of outside interests and potential conflicts of interest provided by TERI officers are reviewed by the Vice President, Administration and the responses from directors are reviewed by the chair of the Audit Committee. If necessary, follow-up action is then taken.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The compensation for TERI's chief executive officer and other officers is determined by the Board of Directors, based on a comparability study prepared by independent consultants. TERI's Board or Executive Committee makes all decisions relating to the compensation of the CEO and TERI's other officers.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TERI makes its governing documents, conflicts of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request, written or oral.

Primary Activity: TERI Financial Services, Inc. fosters and supports educational programs which aid and assist students, parents, and educational institutions in seeking or providing educational opportunities.
